articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Major in F# (Shape: C)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Major in F# (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
The major arpeggio in F# with the shape of C is a fundamental musical element used in various genres of music. It consists of the F# note, the A# note, and the C# note played together in harmony to create a bright and uplifting sound. Arpeggios are commonly used to outline chords and add melodic interest to music.

## Notes and Intervals
- F# (Root)
- A# (Major 3rd)
- C# (Perfect 5th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
This arpeggio is often used in genres such as classical music, jazz, and pop. In classical music, it can add elegance and sophistication to compositions. In jazz, it is utilized for improvisation and adding color to chord progressions. In pop music, it can create a catchy and uplifting melody.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the Major arpeggio in F# (Shape: C):
1. "Canon in D" by Johann Pachelbel
2. "Don't Stop Believin'" by Journey
3. "Clair de Lune" by Claude Debussy
